Class MapCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
              • MapCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseMoveListener, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MiniMapCanvas

    public class MapCanvas
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
implements org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseMoveListener
    Creates a drawable canvas by subclassing SWT.canvas and drawing the images provided through the IMG and IMGLIst classes as a game map on the canvas
    See Also:
    GameMap

      private ImageSet img_set
      1D array of displayed images that parallels the parent map
      private static boolean load_flag
      to avoid duplicate mapCanvas instances from reloading .txt terrain file when constructed
      protected GameMap map
      used by constructor to retain the current ascii game map
      private int x_ori
      used to navigate map
      private int y_ori

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapCanvas

        public MapCanvas(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell sh,
         GameMap map,
         ImageSet imgs)
        constructor calls the parent super constructor, sets up private attributes and then calls the onLoad function to initialize the game map.

        Note: probably does not do a very good check of the proper terrain map being loaded Important: any thing calling this constructor must be a subclass and override drawViewport or the whole thing probably crashes

        Parameters:
        sh - SWT.Shell
        map -
        imgs -

    • Method Detail

      • keyPressed

        private void keyPressed(org.eclipse.swt.events.KeyEvent ke)
        Controls the movement of the MapCanvas in response to the aswd and arrow keys translates both x and y axes to give pseudo planar movement at an angle.
        Parameters:
        ke - is a KeyEvent from the addKeyListener -> KeyAdapter constructor

      • center

        public void center()

      • viewPortDraw

        public void viewPortDraw(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Event event)
        probably should be named DrawCanvas, does not really define a viewport. Function actually draws the entire map regardless of visibility in the shell/canvas.

        Parameters:
        event -

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad()
        onLoad - file dialog to load map file. some of this code is modeled on http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Image-Viewer/Image_viewer.html
